intro: Piriqueta alba, commonly known as white piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its white to pale yellow flowers bloom in the spring and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapting to the arid environments where it thrives.
